author: alex.eth
content: Last 5 epochs on Medalla have hit 65% participation üëÄ

author: ryg9705
content: Can't be a coincidence that participation tanks after getting close to the magic threshold. We reached 66.39% and then went down again.

author: ryg9705
content: We had the same after the roughtime bug.

author: 3esmit.stateofus.eth
content: My validator (in Nimbus) is operating normally, any clients having issues?

author: 3esmit.stateofus.eth
content: Even I'm being an honest node, I am currently at loss over my initial deposit

author: ryg9705
content: I think we have a lot of clients with insufficient RAM. While it doesn't OOM kill them they miss a lot of attestations. Maybe this requirement increases the closer we get to finalizing and this makes them drop off.

author: 3esmit.stateofus.eth
content: And constantly loosing funds... Soon I might get ejected, for no reason

author: 3esmit.stateofus.eth
content: If finalization don't reach for more some weeks I'll get ejected, even though I am running the node everyday. I don't think this is correct.

author: ajsutton
content: 31ETH is still a very long way from getting ejected.  You'd need to drop to 16.75ETH.  Validators which are offline will be losing ETH *much* faster than you and will be ejected first, restoring finality.

author: ajsutton
content: This kind of non-finality is also an artefact of a non-incentivised testnet.  People don't care that their validator is offline because there's no money at stake.  You'd be seeing much greater efforts to get back to finality on MainNet so these long periods of non-finality are exceptionally unlikely.

author: 3esmit.stateofus.eth
content: According my current daily loss of 0,1 ETH, it will take 147 days of non finality for me to be ejected.

author: 3esmit.stateofus.eth
content: Maybe some people that stopped their nodes wanted to validate again but were close of being expulsed and than they loss even being honest and got ejected, maybe that's desirable?
